blog-game-jam-meta-description: A professional website supporting an MMO Discord server with guides, news, and partners.
gamejam-section-intro-text: Participating in my first Game Jam - the Wowie Jam 4.0 - was an exciting experiment. With the theme "Collaborate With AI" and only 72 hours of time, the creative and technical challenge was clear: to develop a game where collaboration with artificial intelligence is at the core of the gameplay.
gamejam-section-team-text:
The project was brought to life by a small but dedicated team - consisting of two programmers,
one musician, and one artist. Each of us contributed our individual strengths to create a functional and atmospheric game experience within the limited time frame.
gamejam-section-theme-text:
In our game â€œJack and Markusâ€, a young boy gets lost in a mysterious forest and must escape the wrath of the forest spirits. Fortunately, he encounters a strange forest creature that helps him find his way to safety.

This companion is not static - it evolves dynamically based on the player's decisions and behavior. Whether as a melee or ranged fighter, its evolution depends on the way the player interacts with it.
This forms the core AI mechanic of our game.
gamejam-section-tech-text: The game was developed using the Godot Engine. The main logic was written in GDScript, with some components implemented in C#. We created a state-based AI system that dynamically adapts the companion's behavior and evolution to the player's actions - for example, by measuring distance, reacting to threats, or responding to interactions.
gamejam-section-challenges-text: The biggest challenge was team communication and coordination - especially under time pressure. Since no tutorials were planned, the level design had to be intuitive. At the same time, we had to deliver working mechanics, a minimalist UI, and a cohesive experience - all of which required quick decisions and pragmatic solutions.
gamejam-section-outro-text:
Participating in the Game Jam was an intense and insightful experience. What impressed me most was how a team with little prior collaboration was able to self-organize and deliver a working game demo in just three days.

Looking back, the project was a valuable experience in making focused decisions and finding creative solutions under pressure - and seeing them result in a tangible outcome. I will carry these lessons into future projects, especially regarding efficient teamwork and agile development under realistic constraints.
